item.title: Bee
item.description: Bee is a desktop blog editor build on Adobe AIR in HTML/JavaScript. Bee integrates WordPress blogging platform and Flickr photo sharing support and offers simple unified workflows for photo blogging.

item.title: Drag'n Share
item.description: Drag'n Share lets you manage your documents on Google Documents by dragging them to or from the desktop. The application connects to the Google Documents Service and is built with HTML/Javascript using the Yahoo! UI framework.

item.title: Fresh
item.description: Fresh is a skinnable RSS reader built entirely using Ajax running on Adobe AIR. The Fresh reader features offline RSS reading, multiple panels within a single window, tabbed browsing, and basic browser integration

item.title: PeekAgenda
item.description: This sample application uses the Backpack APIs from 37signals to keep track of your tasks. PeekAgenda shows how an Ajax-based desktop application can work offline to create lists and then synchronize this data using Backpack APIs.

item.title: PodcastPlayer
item.description: PodcastPlayer is an easy-to-use Ajax application that allows you to subscribe and listen to your favorite podcasts. Check out how PodcastPlayer calls the Adobe AIR sound APIs from HTML to play audio without using any Flash or Flex.

item.title: RoadFinder
item.description: Roadfinder combines two of the most popular online maps, Yahoo! Maps and Google Maps, into a single application. Search for an address by typing it in or dragging it from the desktop.

item.title: Signet
item.description: This sample application enables you to take your del.icio.us bookmarks to the desktop.

item.title: SyncIn
item.description: SyncIn is a sample application that demonstrates how to communicate and keep in synchronization two lists: one displayed in HTML and one displayed in a PDF object.
